oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett (regarding the signing of the Armistice)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett (1892-1951) served in Btry. F, 318th FA Regt., 81st Div. during World War I. The letter, written on YMCA letterhead, is addressed to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett, in Huntingdon, Tennessee. He writes about the "good news about what Germany did," likely in reference to the signing of the Armistice on November 11, 1918 that marked the end of World War I.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
